intro: Tapeinosperma vieillardii, commonly known as the African sandthorn, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and spiny, woody stems. The plant produces small, oval fruits that contain a single seed enclosed in a hard, woody capsule. It is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies of desert flora.
